ARABIC: لَا تُحَرِّكْ بِهِۦ لِسَانَكَ لِتَعْجَلَ بِهِۦٓ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Do not move your tongue trying to hasten it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Do not forestall (the revelation before its completion) by acting in haste.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: (O Prophet), do not stir your tongue hastily (to commit the Revelation to memory).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: (Muhammad), do not move your tongue too quickly to recite the Quran.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: O dear Prophet (Mohammed – peace and blessings be upon him), do not cause your tongue to move along with the Qur’an in order to learn it faster.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Move not your tongue concerning to make haste therewith.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Do not move your tongue with it to make haste with it,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Move not thy tongue with it to hasten it;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Stir not thy tongue herewith to hasten it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: [Prophet], do not move your tongue too fast in your attempt to learn this revelation:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Move not thy tongue therewith that thou mayest hasten therewith.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Do not move your tongue with it to hasten it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Move not thy tongue concerning the (Qur'an) to make haste therewith.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Move not your tongue concerning (the Quran, O Muhammad SAW) to make haste therewith.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Do not move your tongue with it (the Revelation) to hasten it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Do not wag your tongue with it, to hurry on with it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Move not your tongue with it, [O Muhammad], to hasten with recitation of the Qur'an.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [75:16] God, exalted be He, says to His Prophet: Do not move your tongue with it, with the Qur’ān, before Gabriel is through with [reciting] it, to hasten it, fearing to lose it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Stir not thy tongue) to read the Qur'an, Muhammad, (herewith to hasten it) to hasten the recitation of the Qur'an before Gabriel finishes reciting it to you. This is because the Prophet (pbuh) used to repeat whatever revelations of the Qur'an Gabriel brought down to him before the latter finished a sentence of the Qur'an, out of fear of forgetting what was revealed to him. Allah warned him against doing so.
